planet.description: Formalhaut is one of the brightest stars in the night sky and located in the constellation Piscis Austrinus. It is a young star with a debris disk. In 2008 astronomers reported the discovery of a planet orbiting the star within the debris disk. Two images from the Hubble space telescope showed motion consistent with a Keplerian orbit. The discovery was not confirmed in subsequent images. The planet is therefore listed as controversial.
